<<<<<<< HEAD
Certaine petitions presented by the Lord Maior, and commonalty of the Citie of London, to the honorable House of Commons, shewing, the great inconveniences of protections, priviledges and priviledged places, with the allegations and reasons tendred by the committees, appointed by Common Councell of the City of London, against the same: being voted by a committee of the lower House. City of London (England). Court of Common Council.
[2], 6 p.
Printed for George Badger, London : 1641.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
Certaine petitions presented by the Lord Maior, and commonalty of the Citie of London, to the honorable House of Commons, shewing, the great inconveniences of protections, priviledges and priviledged places, with the allegations and reasons tendred by the committees, appointed by Common Councell of the City of London, against the same: being voted by a committee of the lower House. City of London (England). Court of Common Council.
[2], 6 p.
Printed for George Badger, London : 1641.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
George Badger
